description:
I wanted/tried to capture Cat's Paw Nebula for years and finally got it done this year. It was very low between 14~16 degrees above the horizon (1.5 hours image times). This image is an SHO Hubble palette of colors with RGB stars.  
C & C are welcome.
Jian Yuan Peng

--- Facts --
NGC 6334, (a.k.a. the Cat's Paw Nebula, Bear Claw Nebula, or Gum 64) is an emission nebula and star-forming region located in the constellation Scorpius about 5,500 light-years from the Earth. NGC 6334, discovered by astronomer John Herschel in 1837, is one of the nearest H II regions to the solar system and about 50 light-years across. The large glowing cloud earned the nickname Catâ€™s Paw because it looks like a gigantic pawprint of a cat. 

Technical details:
Telescope: TEC 160FL + TEC FRC 0.9x
Mount: Astro-Physics 1100GTO
Imaging cameras: ZWO ASI6200MM
Software: PHD2, PixInsight, Lightroom 6.4, Sequence Generator Pro, Photoshop CS6
Location: Palo Alto, California, USA
PhotometricColorCalibration data (preCorp):
Resolution ............... 0.784 arcsec/px
Rotation ................. -179.240 deg
Reference system ......... ICRS
Observation start time ... 2021-05-18 08:42:14 UTC
Observation end time ..... 2021-06-15 06:55:19 UTC
Focal distance ........... 988.81 mm
Pixel size ............... 3.76 um
Field of view ............ 1d 58' 16.7" x 1d 19' 44.4"
Image center ............. RA: 17 19 48.955  Dec: -35 51 31.33

Astrodon 50mm Unmounted 3nm Narrowband Ha, SII, OIII filters
Blue   36x120"      72 Minutes                  Bin1x1 
Green  34x120"      68 Minutes                  Bin1x1 
Red    35x120"      70 Minutes                  Bin1x1 
Ha     37x900"      9.25 Hours  Bin1x1  
OIII   37x900"      9.25 Hours  Bin1x1 
SII    36x900" 	    9 Hours  Bin1x1
title: NGC 6334 (Cat's Paw Nebula, Bear Claw Nebula) SHO+RGB stars
